text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section and I have a question for you do
you want to make holiday cookies but
feel too frazzled I mean you've got your
kids you have your family coming in
you've got your job well I'm going to
show you a really easy way to do it now
if you think I'm talking about
painstaking cookies like these that take
hours and hours to do you're on so the
first thing you're gonna do is make your
favorite recipe for either gingerbread
or sugar cookies take your dough form it
into two separate disks wrap it in saran
stick in the fridge until it's very cold
you want to make sure the dough is
thoroughly chilled so it doesn't warm up
too much when you're rolling so what you
want to do is just put a little flour
right down on the surface and a little
flour on your dough if you're worried
about using too much flour you can also
go ahead and roll it between two pieces
of wax paper that works really well too
but I like to have the control which
flower gives me my dough is rolled out
about a quarter-inch thick and now I'm
gonna cut it out you want to cut as
close together as you can using all
different shapes the object is to have
as few little scraps as possible but
you'll have two reroll so what I'm using
is cookie cutters of many different
sizes and I'm getting right in here
right wherever there's a little space
I'm going to cut out a teeny little
kitty cat we're just gonna bake them at
350 you want to bake them for about 10
to 12 minutes until they're really Brown
on the bottom you don't want them to be
solved
to frost the cookies I like to use royal
icing because it sets up really hard and
that way you can stack your cookies if
you use something like buttercream it
always stays a little bit soft and so
what I'm going to do is I've got egg
whites in the machine three egg whites
I'm gonna add a pound of confectioner's
sugar and just a few little drops of
lemon juice and now this is important to
start it on slow or your confectioner
sugar is gonna just fly up everywhere
and then we're gonna beat it on high
until fluffy so now I'm just gonna let
this run for about five minutes until
it's really glossy and shiny and set if
you don't want to use raw egg whites for
any reason there's a great product on
the market called meringue powder you
just add a little bit of water and you
fluff it up in the mixer and it'll work
great and this is what you're looking
for beautiful it's glossy and it's thick
but it's not stiff okay now I'm going to
tint the royal icing different colors
you should make a lot of different
colors because it's really fun to mix
them up I like to use a really
concentrated food coloring because it's
the most vibrant colors so I take my
little toothpick it's like my magic wand
and I just apply a little drop of color
to each pot
now is the fun part call the kids in
unlock your inner Picasso and just go so
what I've got here are different colored
sugars and you just sprinkle them right
on the icing and here's my little
dancing man and now I'm gonna paint him
you can go ahead and buy paintbrushes at
an art supply store but I just like to
use pastry brushes you just want to do
it fast to get the color on and then the
colored sugar is gonna hide all your
mistakes
so this guy looks a little bit like
Gumby but we're gonna turn him in to
father Christmas just sprinkle them
right on and there he is dancing father
Gumby Christmas kids will love them it's
all about mixing and matching white with
white green with yellow yellow with
orange these cookies are fun to make
these cookies are fast they're
rustically beautiful and unlike those
really fancy cookies that people are
kind of hesitant to eat these cookies
are gonna go quick
